text: twenty-two-year-old journey Clark is an
English convert with slum she recently
started wearing the niqab the garment
that covers everything but her eyes a
lot of people now they assume that I'm
not English they assume I'm from
Afghanistan or Saudi Arabia I'm a
typical white English girl under this
well you wouldn't think that would you
really cuz all you can really see is my
eyes or my hands
Johnnie lips with her two young sons in
Penge
but now she says she's been forced to
move house because she's had so much
abuse verbal and physical since she
began wearing the veil
according to tell mama an independent
group that monitors attacks on Muslims
women are the most vulnerable
we realized that Muslim women who were
visible who wore the hijab the headscarf
are suffering more of the targeted abuse
and we also realized that women who wore
the niqab the face veil suffered more
aggressive incidences so there was
something about the face veil that in a
way brought out the worst in the
perpetrator brought up in East London
eighteen-year-old Mina is proud of her
jewelled Bangladeshi British heritage
but her decision to wear the niqab has
made her a target for violence as well I
know it's this woman and all of a sudden
you know she started coming at us and
sort of saying like you know what are
you doing here we don't trust you and
she pulled my face fell down and she
pushed me to the floor Joni has now
moved to Whitechapel and Mina's attacker
was prosecuted but both women remain
fearful about the divisions emerging in
Britain today they collaborate with the
global banking system to bring masses of
third-world people into this country to
replace rape and murder are people
keeping your dangerous dangerous to the
public
never the people who are dangerous are
the ones in control of drones and bombs
like the UK come
